snippet: Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, captured in Libya this month, was to be presented before a federal judicial officer on Tuesday after he stopped eating and drinking aboard a Navy vessel.
abstract: Terrorism suspect Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai is brought to New York to appear before federal judge; decision to bring Ruqai to New York was made due to chronic health problems worsened after he stopped eating and drinking aboard Navy vessel in Mediterranean after being captured in Libya.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN WEISER, CHARLIE SAVAGE and ERIC SCHMITT

lead_paragraph: Nazih Abdul-Hamed al-Ruqai, captured in Libya this month, was to be presented before a federal judicial officer on Tuesday after he stopped eating and drinking aboard a Navy vessel.

headline.main: Qaeda Suspect Is Brought to New York for a Hearing
headline.print_headline: Qaeda Suspect Is Brought To New York for a Hearing
